questions.question_text:
A project manager has taken over a project that has been without a project manager for the last couple of weeks. The team is feeling lost and there are a few team members who are confused about the next steps and the final outcome of the project.

What should the new project manager do?

choices.C: Avoid conflict and let the team self-organize on how they want to work on the project tasks.
choices.A: Set short-term goals in order to create a winning culture internally and praise team members for achieving them.
choices.D: Escalate the situation to the steering committee and request that more time be allotted to the project.
choices.B: Ask the project sponsor to provide team members with a project direction regarding outcomes.

questions.question_text:
A project manager is leading a project that will be delivered using a Scrum framework. The organization has an innovative project management office (PMO) that fully supports agile and also has a very friendly procurement team. A new vendor needs to be engaged to provide more developers for a new reporting platform.

What should the project manager do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
While Scrum and agile practices emphasize flexibility and adaptability, procurement—especially when involving third-party vendors—still requires adherence to formal procedures to ensure that the engagement is legitimate, compliant, and in line with organizational and legal requirements.

Selected Answer: B

A project manager is assigned to a time-bound internal project on quality improvement. During project execution, the project manager observes that a specific team member is being isolated by other team members.

Which three actions should the project manager take? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:

D is the answer. There must be team cohesion and only option D can forester collaboration and team team building. All other 3 options will cause separation and poor team spirit.

Selected Answer: D
Scheduling a team-building activity helps create an environment where team members can get to know each other and the project manager in a relaxed and informal setting. This can help build trust and rapport, which are essential for effective teamwork. Meeting personally with team members allows the project manager to understand the individual strengths, weaknesses, and dynamics within the team. This knowledge is crucial for effectively managing and leveraging the diverse skills of both senior and junior professionals. Team-building activities encourage collaboration and communication among team members, helping to break down barriers and create a more cohesive team. This is particularly important in a team with varying levels of experience.

questions.question_text:
A project manager has been appointed to lead a project but has not previously worked with the project team members. The project manager notices that the team is a mix of senior and junior professionals.

What should the project manager do to start establishing a successful relationship?

choices.B: Include project stakeholder expectations and needs while creating project acceptance criteria.
choices.D: Discuss project acceptance criteria with the project sponsor before the execution phase.
choices.C: Schedule regular meetings with project stakeholders to make sure they are satisfied.
choices.A: Create a statement of work (SOW) and ensure it remains unchanged during the project life cycle.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The most effective way to ensure that project acceptance criteria are met is to define them based on stakeholder needs and expectations from the start. This way, all deliverables will be evaluated against agreed-upon standards, leading to smoother acceptance processes.
